dt: {bc}a pointed or projecting part of a garment
{bc}the visor of a cap or hat
{bc}the top of a hill or mountain ending in a point

dt.t: the fog hung … heavily on the {wi}peak{/wi} of the hill

dt: {bc}a prominent mountain usually having a well-defined summit

dt.t: Beat the cream until it forms stiff {wi}peaks{/wi}.

dt: {bc}the upper aftermost corner of a fore-and-aft sail
{bc}the narrow part of a ship's bow or stern or the part of the hold in it

dt.t: a singer at the {wi}peak{/wi} of her popularity

dt: {bc}a high point in a course of development especially as represented on a graph

dt.t: The graph shows that murders in the city reached a {wi}peak{/wi} two years ago.

pt: {sc}summit{/sc} {sc}peak{/sc} {sc}pinnacle{/sc} {sc}climax{/sc} {sc}apex{/sc} {sc}acme{/sc} {sc}culmination{/sc} mean the highest point attained or attainable. {sc}summit{/sc} implies the topmost level attainable.

pt.t: at the {it}summit{/it} of the Victorian social scene

pt: {sc}peak{/sc} suggests the highest among other high points.

pt.t: an artist working at the {it}peak{/it} of her powers

pt: {sc}pinnacle{/sc} suggests a dizzying and often insecure height.
{sc}climax{/sc} implies the highest point in an ascending series.

pt.t: the war was the {it}climax{/it} to a series of hostile actions

pt: {sc}apex{/sc} implies the point where all ascending lines converge.
{sc}acme{/sc} implies a level of quality representing the perfection of a thing.

pt.t: a statue that was once deemed the {it}acme{/it} of beauty

pt: {sc}culmination{/sc} suggests the outcome of a growth or development representing an attained objective.

shortdef: a pointed or projecting part of a garment; especially : the visor of a cap or hat

dt: {bc}to reach a maximum (as of capacity, value, or activity)
{bc}to cause to come to a peak, point, or maximum

shortdef: to reach a maximum (as of capacity, value, or activity) —often used with out
to cause to come to a peak, point, or maximum

dt.t: Wang thinks that groundwater was jolted free by the quake. The water then trickled down into the streams and reached a {wi}peak{/wi} outpour about 30 days later.
Air-conditioning is also one of the main contributors to {wi}peak{/wi} electric power demand …

dt: {bc}of, relating to, or being a period of maximum intensity or activity

dt.t: And because women, as a whole, leave later for work than men, they tend to travel right smack-dab in the {wi}peak{/wi} hours of congestion (and even more so in the afternoon {wi}peak{/wi} hours, which is partially why those tend to be worse.)

dt: {bc}being at the height of popularity, use, or attention
used before the name of a product, person, cultural trend, etc.

dt.t: Just when you think we've surely reached {wi}peak{/wi} bourbon, someone else ups the ante. No longer is it enough to have the oldest, the rarest, or the most expensive whiskey, or even to pick a personal barrel from a distillery.
All this is to say, we are at {wi}peak{/wi} Wes Anderson—or rather, we have been for a very, very long time. We have to ask: why is this style so easy to send up? And why is it so hard to dislodge?

shortdef: being at or reaching the maximum; also : of, relating to, or being a period of maximum intensity or activity
being at the height of popularity, use, or attention —used before the name of a product, person, cultural trend, etc.

dt: {bc}to set (a gaff, a yard, etc.) nearer the perpendicular

shortdef: to set (a gaff, a yard, etc.) nearer the perpendicular
to hold (oars) with blades well raised

dt: {bc}a device that measures the maximum rate of air flow out of the lungs during forced expiration and that is used especially for monitoring lung capacity of asthmatics

shortdef: a device that measures the maximum rate of air flow out of the lungs during forced expiration and that is used especially for monitoring lung capacity of asthmatics

dt: {bc}the time when tourists visit the most

dt.t: During {it}peak season{/it}, the island is very crowded.

shortdef: the time when tourists visit the most

dt: {bc}not being in the period of maximum use or business {bc}not peak

shortdef: not being in the period of maximum use or business : not peak

dt: {bc}a point formed by the hairline in front

shortdef: a point formed by the hairline in front

dt: mountain 7360 feet (2243 meters) high in south central Sri Lanka

shortdef: mountain 7360 feet (2243 meters) high in south central Sri Lanka
